title: Opening up Macedonia

author: Zoran Janevski, St. Cyril and Methodius University in Skopje

segmentation: Good afternoon everybody, thanks for.
Your presence.
Today and let me to introduce myself Anzora nevski.
I'm coming from the Institute of Economix, from the Sensible and Methodius University, from Scorpia.
And I'm associate professor and I'm also member and co-founder of Oil Alliance in Macedonia.
So let me give you a brief overview on Olean.
We are in Macedonia.
And.
At the beginning I must say that I will criticise a lot.
I will be optimistic from time to time.
And.
After those few presentation.
I will start with the few burning issues regarding going annoyer in Macedonia.
I will point on few of them.
Rising awareness of OE or no, you know you are.
Lack of policy.
And so it was mentioned from the college from Serbia.
It's also very.
Very big issue in Macedonia is how to motivate the creator of open educational resources.
We have tried with.
Organizing her contest for teachers in primary and secondary schools.
We've did it 3 times for the last three years and the results are pretty good.
There are many, many teachers interested too.
To compete and to apply for the for the reward.
So.
So.
Just a few facts and data.
On education.
On formal education in the country.
Just to present that it's a very important sector for the country and a lot of people, teachers and students are involved in the education.
Not mentioning the other stakeholders, parents for example then.
And others.
And.
In in the country, education has a constitutional basis and it's defined as a public good, not just by the Constitution, but but also by several.
Lowe's for example law on primary education law on secondary education.
Low and high indication low on textbooks for primary secondary education and low on Copyright and related rights.
But still.
There is no policy on.
On already and all we are.
None of these laws are about creation, use and sharing of open educational resources.
But still, a lot of things have been done in the past and.
A lot of things should be done even more in future, but.
On the top of what is already done, I think that we could.
Work on harder and.
We we should be focused more on the results.
How to introduce oil and we are in the country.
So I will go briefly on in each of these laws just to make points where are some relations to the OE and we are.
So according to the law on Primary Education.
Primary education is mandatory and is free of charge.
It is defined as a public interest.
And according to this law.
In the process of teaching ID technologies, especially Internet, must be used.
And it's very, very good point, and this obligation is determined even in the syllabus and in in the program for grades and courses.
Secondary education is also defined as a public interest.
It is mandatory an in the public schools is free of charge.
According to the Law on Textbooks for Primary and secondary education textbooks.
Are free of charge.
And the critical and the silver before certain grades or subjects.
Are proposed by the beta for Development of Education and approved by the Minister of Education and Science.
The Law on Copyright and related Rights defines the principles that regulate the rights of the authors of textbooks.
Regardless, the of the form of the textbooks printed or electronic, but the minister and the author of the textbooks sign a contract for transfer of copyrights.
Add to the to the Ministry of Education and Science.
In the past.
Huh?
There were a lot of projects and initiatives, but I must say sporadic initiatives, but still a lot of results.
Our present these days.
But many of them are.
Must be questioned.
For example, in 2007, the government launched the computer for every student project.
And now after 10 years there is no official information.
How much the project cost and it is only an assumption that more than 60 million euros have been spent on this project.
And nobody knows what is the real impact of this project.
Not to mention that.
A lot of this equipment is vanished and it's ruined and.
Not functioning anymore.
The Ministry of Information Society and Administration, in cooperation with the Intel Company, provided more than 500 digital education contents in 2009.
And in 2010, the National Strategy and Action Plan Free content development was released, but.
Actually it was too late because the goal of this strategy is.
Is to identify and to develop some actions.
How to use.
Already provided computers in teaching and learning process.
In 2009 etextbooks portal random.
It is actually a random fragmented and unregulated portal for Open Access to textbooks in Macedonia was launched.
And I must say that it is.
A digital library.
For storing, searching and browsing the textbooks, but it should be.
But still it's far away from.
From being this.
In 2011 a big video content aggregator was launched and there were many other.
Repositories, web portals and websites.
Digital libraries with.
We are content and other digital educational materials.
I will say a few words about etextbooks portal.
It is very important to mention it because it could be used as a really strong foundation.
On which on the top we could.
Build up further actions on developing GUI and we are in the country.
So.
It is important for textbooks, mostly for students of primary and secondary schools.
Ann should grow.
Into main centralized resource for access.
For many other etextbooks, however.
This expectation.
And promises with they don't match with reality, primarily because.
There are serious failings in absence of a comprehensive policy and procedures for its implementation.
Actually, the portal has not been even legally foreseen.
And the portal should and could provide added value, but it doesn't actually improve the creativity of the educational process actually.
In fact, it is just a digital copy of existing educational resources.
The portal is a part of a public policy and educational system.
Public money spent for it.
Yet there is no official document defining its operation and responsibilities.
This condition arises from the origins of etextbooks, despite its eight years of existence, it leaves an impression of randomness.
Actually it is a static window below the standard level of digital communication.
There are some parts still not developed, for example, search feature is still under construction after 7 eight years of functioning of this portal.
So one of the.
Essential.
Feature of digital content cannot be used with this textbooks.
Also, the portal provides some incomplete textbooks, which is what is maybe even even worse.
And.
The absence of creating common slogan globalists is evident.
Despite there is no good reason not to use this in the textbooks, but.
It is because of the lack of awareness by.
I can say all stakeholders first of all.
Mostly by the Ministry of Education, but also by the authors and commercial publishers.
Routers of these textbooks have heard, but do not really know much about, the Open Access to textbooks or do not know anything of it.
So most of the authors authors are not aware how to protect their copyrights within Open Access textbooks on the Internet.
So.
I said I said at the beginning, I will criticize a lot.
But still.
There are some bright.
Activities and initiatives.
For example, in 2012.
One of the most recognized civil society organization in the Country, Metamorphosis Foundation made significant progress in terms of rising awareness.
Among the members of the Academy community in the country.
And.
These activities continue with establishing of the Uer coordinated group.
And in 2013 the We are coordinated group was expanded to an alliance for year in Macedonia.
Today, more than 500 individuals and 20 organizations are part of this alliance.
There is a.
Significant Resource Center of with more than.
4600 resources published on this.
Web portal of the alliance.
And.
What do you have done in the past?
We prepared the declaration on.
We are in Macedonia based on the Paris Declaration.
In cooperation with the National Commission for UNESCO of Macedonia.
We developed a web application for signing this declaration and all of this 500 and plus individuals and 20 institutions have signed this declaration through this application.
We have organized many roundtables with.
Participants from.
Government from educator from academia from universities, libraries, nongovernmental organizations.

And we started discussions with the government with several ministries with Ministry of Education and Science with Ministry of Information Society and Administration on ovr cooperation and preparation for the low amendments but.
Nothing's happened.
Put the last two three years.
Also we work on production and distribution of promotional.
We are materials.
And.
But still we have a lot.
Challenges.
And plans for the future.
We will try to.
Work on sustainability of on.
Oh Ian.
We are through introduction of of open education and open education resources into the loan textbooks and also other either related loss.
The alliance should try to become more recognizable and.
Which even bigger membership member.
With more members, our goals is to have more than 1000 individuals and around 50 organizations.
Well, we are trying to.
Sign a long term agreement with Metamorphosis Foundation and will try to cooperate with other promoters and supporters of Olivia.
Nowhere in the country.
We will continue and intensify discussions with the government and especially with the Ministry of Education and Science, and we will try to establish a real partnership with them.
And we will continue work on rising awareness among all the stakeholders in the country.
So it was very briefly if you have any question please.
OK, thank you.
